content: wooly bear hand knits hats from the heart please make this hat for someone who needs warmth use wool alpaca or some other warm soft fiber take it to your local shelter give it to someone who is cold or donate it to charity thanks for sharing your gift of knitting with others materials yarn worsted weight wool approx 175 yds you can add contrasting stripes and make it as colorful as you wish needles sz 816 circular and sz 8 double points or the entire hat can be done on double points one stitch marker sampleswereknitted worsted weight wool from my stash gauge worked in k2 p2 ribbing with ribbing relaxed not stretched 26 st and 21 row= 4 size ribbingis very stretchy so the cap fit most adults and older children hat length is adjustable according to how farthe wearer rolls the brim watch cap with circular needle cast on 88 stitches join in a circle being sure not to twist place a marker for the beginning of the round work in k2 p2 ribbing for about 11 or until desired length decreases change to double point needles when necessary round 1 k2 p2tog around 66st rnds 2 3 k2 p1 around round 4 k2tog p1 around 44st round 5 k1 p1 around round 6 k1 p1 around until you reach the last p1 move this stitch to beginning of needle 1 round 7 k2tog around you will be knitting a k st with a p st each time 22st round 8 k around round 9 k2tog around 11st cut yarn leaving a 6 tail draw tail through the last stitches drawtightly closed and fasten on inside of cap weavein ends woolybearhandknits@yahoo com wooly bear hand knits 258 short place louisville co 80027 copyright cheryl andrews 2009 author gives permission for you to make copies please make as many copies as you d like and share them with others please do not sell these hats -give them away from your heart
